title: Rate law for the decomposition of ozone

content.question:
<math alttext="O 3 gas plus O gas produces 2 O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
The decomposition of <math alttext="O 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> occurs according to the balanced equation above. In the presence of <math alttext="N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the decomposition proceeds in two elementary steps, as represented by the following mechanism.
Step 1: <math alttext="O 3 plus N O produces N O 2 plus O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) Step 2: <math alttext="N O 2 plus O produces N O plus O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>O</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) 
Based on the information, which of the following is the rate law?

choices.label: <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of O 3, times the molar concentration of N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>NO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>O]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O, times the molar concentration of O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><mtext>NO][</mtext><mtext>O]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of O 3, times the molar concentration of N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>NO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
